intro: Trigonella capitata, commonly known as the yellow horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Trigonella capitata is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
